resources.string: Fill the fields correctly to continue
1. During the last 7 days, on how many days did you do vigorous physical activities?
2. How much time did you usually spend doing vigorous physical activities on one of those days?
3. During the last 7 days, on how many days did you do moderate physical activities?
4. How much time did you usually spend doing moderate physical activities on one of those days?
5. During the last 7 days, on how many days did you walk for at least 10 minutes at a time?
7. During the last 7 days, how much time did you usually spend sitting on a week day?
6. How much time did you usually spend walking on one of those days?

Now think about the time you spent sitting on week days during the last 7 days. Include time spent at work, at home, while doing course work, and during leisure time. This may include time spent sitting at a desk, visiting friends, reading or sitting or lying down to watch television.

Now think about the time you spent walking in the last 7 days. This includes at work and at home, walking to travel from place to place, and any other walking that you have done solely for recreation, sport, exercise, or leisure.

Now think about activities which take moderate physical effort that you did in the last 7 days. Moderate physical activities make you breathe somewhat harder than normal and may include carrying light loads, bicycling at a regular pace, or doubles tennis. Do not include walking. Again, think about only those physical activities that you did for at least 10 minutes at a time.
No studies,Primary studies,Secondary studies,Professional training,Bachelor\'s degree,Master\'s degree,Doctoral degree

NoDisponibleEnVersionPublica/string> NoDisponibleEnVersionPublica NoDisponibleEnVersionPublica NoDisponibleEnVersionPublica fileNamePersonalLoginInfo.txt Logout Nickname Password Bad user, not register Bad password 155.54.95.x 8000 /login Server error communication ^[a-z]{2,}\\d*$ Logging success ^\\w+([-+.\']\\w+)*@\\w+([-.]\\w+)*\\.\\w+([-.]\\w+)*$ ^[1-9][0-9]*$ Username Repeat password Bad username format Bad postal code format Bad email format Passwords are not the same /register ^(?:The\\suser\\salready\\sexists:\\s)(.*)$ The username already exists User register successful First step for wristband connection. In this window the physical information of the user is collected to improve the application of the wristband to be linked. Height Weight Stride Personal config Continue Connect Third step for the connection of the wristband. In this activity the first connection to the wristband is made and a file transfer can also be made if desired. Once the first connection is made, the device is saved in memory and the transfer and update can be called from the main activity. Scans devices Second step for the connection of the wristband. In this window the available wristbands are scanned near the phone. The application must be given bluetooth permissions. While scanning the wristband it must be in scanable mode. Symbols of a bracelet and a phone must appear on the bracelet screen, not to be confused with the reconnection that has the same symbolism with watches inside. Once detected, it must be selected by clicking on the list where the device appears. Scan Stop scan fileNameJsonDataDevice.txt /device Services status "Wristband service: " "Data service: " "Wristband connected: " Launch wristband service Launch data service Check services Wristband Status /weather Geoposition service: /surveys fileNameJsonDataSurveys.txt Male,Female,Other No studies,Primary studies,Secondary studies,Professional training,Bachelor\'s degree,Master\'s degree,Doctoral degree Physical status Diet adherence Treatment adherence Social support Stress Anxiety Depression Choose survey Personal registration data Username: Name: Surname: Birthdate: Gender: Birth country: Region: City: ZP: Address: Email: Education level: Home country: Running service Health Care High Blood Pressure Yes No 1. Do you use olive oil as the main fat when cooking? 2. How much olive oil do you consume in total per day (including oil used for frying, when eating out in salads, etc.)? 4 spoons or more less than 4 spoons 3. How many portions of vegetables do you eat per day? (garnishes or accompaniments = 1/2 portion) 1 portion = 200g 2 or more (at least one in salad or raw vegetables) less than 2 or none in salad 4. How many pieces of fruit (including natural juice) do you consume per day? 3 or more per day less than 3 per day 5. How many portions of red meat, hamburgers, sausages or cold cuts do you eat per day? (portion: 100 - 150 g) less than 1 per day 1 or more per day 6. How many portions of butter, margarine or cream do you consume per day? (single portion: 12 g) less than 1 per day 1 or more per day 7. How many carbonated and/or sweetened drinks (soft drinks, colas, tonic, bitter) do you consume per day? less than 1 per day 1 or more per day 8. Do you drink wine? How much wine do you consume per week? 7 or more glasses per week less than 7 glasses per week 9. How many portions of vegetables do you eat per week? (150 gr = 1 plate or portion) 3 or more per week less than 3 per week 10. How many portions of seafood do you eat per week? ( 100-150gr of fish = 1 portion; 4-5 pieces or 200gr of seafood = 1 portion). 3 or more per week less than 3 per week 11. How many times per week do you consume factory/processed baked goods such as cookies, custards, candy or cakes? less than 2 per week 2 or more per week 12. How many times per week do you eat nuts? (ration 30 g) 3 or more per week less than 3 per week 13. Do you eat chicken, turkey or rabbit instead of beef, pork, hamburgers or sausages? (chicken meat: 1 piece or portion of 100 - 150 g) 14. How many times per week do you consume cooked vegetables, pasta, rice or other dishes seasoned with tomato sauce, garlic, onion or leek cooked in low heat with olive oil (Sauté)? 2 or more per week less than 2 per week 1. Is there someone avaliable to whom you can count on to listen to you when you need to talk? None of the time A little of the time Some of the time Most of the time All of the time 2. Is there someone avaliable to you to give you good advice about a problem? 3. Is there someone avaliable to you who shows you love and affection? 4. Is there someone avaliable to help with daily chores? 5. Can you count on anyone to provide you with emotional support (talking over problems or helping you make a difficult decision)? 6. Do you have as much contact as you would like with someone you feel close to, someone in whom you can trust and confide in? 7. Are you currently married or living with a partner? Never Hardly ever Occasionally Often Very often 1. How often have you been affected by something that has happened unexpectedly? 2. How often have you felt unable to control the important things in your life? 3. How often have you felt nervous or stressed? 4. How often have you successfully managed life\'s small irritating problems? 5. How often have you felt that you have effectively dealt with the major changes that have been occurring in your life? 6. How often have you been confident about your ability to manage your personal problems? 7. How often have you felt that things are going well for you? 8. How often have you felt that you could not cope with all the tasks you had to do? 9. How often have you been able to manage the difficulties in your life? 10. How often have you felt that you had everything under control? 11. How often have you been angry because things that have happened to you were out of your control? 12. How often have you thought about the things you still have to do? 13. How often have you been able to control how you spend your time? 14. How often have you felt that your difficulties are accumulating so much that you cannot overcome them? Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day) "Some or a little of the time (1‐2 days) " "Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3‐4 days) " All of the time (5‐7 days) "1. I was bothered by things that usually don't bother me. " "2. I had trouble keeping my mind on what I was doing. " "3. I felt depressed. " 4. I felt that everything I did was an effort. 5. I felt hopeful about the future. "6. I felt fearful. " 7. My sleep was restless. "8. I was happy. " "9. I felt lonely. " 10.
